intro: Gomidesia widgreniana, commonly known as the Widgren's gomidesia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
